page.title: 04CUMULUS ORGANICS,HIGNHAM
page.content: Since 1945,farmers have been pumping the soil full of chemicals in a bid to inprove yields.Experts and the public are both worried about the state of the country's soil and quality of the food we eat. In this climate of concern local businessman Mr. David Wilkin has set up a company to market natural fertilisers to replace damaging chemicals -"{CUMULUS ORGANICS}"- of Two-Mile lane Highnam was set up early in 1985.At present the turnover is Â£1000 per month.Products include liquid organic fertilisers and soil conditoiners. Such products should improve damaged soil,prevent further damage and benefit the quality of food supply- all 3 being praise-worthy endeavours.
